metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1349 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
named in ISC BIND 9.7.0 through 9.9.6 before 9.9.6-P2 and 9.10.x before9.10.1-P2, when DNSSEC validation and the managed-keys feature are enabled,allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure anddaemon exit, or daemon crash) by triggering an incorrect trust-anchormanagement scenario in which no key is ready for use.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1349` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.2').
